events.name: Last Wednesday Clojure Coders Meetup
events.description: This is the third meetup of the re-inaugurated Singapore Clojure Group. We are a very mixed bunch, from newbies to Clojure to language contributors. We are enthusiastic about learning and using Clojure and promoting it's use through sharing.  Agenda • Eating & Drinking Food and Drinks kindly donated by our hosts, Neo Innovation • Welcome / Introduction • Editor and Workflow Roundup: • Karol Andrusieczko: IntelliJ+Cursive + the "Stuart Sierra" workflow • Mike Anderson: Eclipse+Counterclockwise • Yu-Xi Lim: Emacs/Cider  •  WANTED: Someone to show off Vim/Fireplace (contact @gabehollombe to fill this spot)  • Friendly networking chats

events.name: [talk] Virtual/Augmented Reality for Retail and Advertising
events.description: It is evident that Virtual Reality is going to revolutionise a number of industries. This time we  will be discussing how we going to apply Virtual Reality technology to Advertising and Virtual Retail. Imagine the possibility of setting up storefront just like how we create websites like html now. So as, hire a virtual shopkeeper for your virtual storefront. Imagine the possibility to curate a virtual building of all the rooms, just like orchard road. Each room is a virtual shop in the building. Imagine the possibility to bring your possible customer to place or experience that you want them to experience to advertise your product. Such as taking your customer to taste a glimpse of Japan before showing them the Japan tour package. The $22tn retail industry is for us, the Virtual Reality Enthusiast to explore and set pace. Being able to simulate the real shopping experience whilst in the comfort of their own home is another big step from the present online shopping experiences.  And for marketers looking to VR / AR as a way of delivering richer brand experiences, we’ll look at examples from Nissan, Castrol, Marriott Hotels, Dior and Patron. So let discuss and share about what can we, the VR Enthusiast brings to this market. We would also be having a speaker to share about : •  How agencies and brands are starting to apply VR / AR technologies to their advertising and marketing efforts - Don Anderson, Regional Managing Director, We Are Social @whateyeread  • Explore the reality - Ender Jiang, Chief Marketing Technologist, Hiverlab • DigiQuin - A smart virtual wardrobe and mannequin - Nick Lee, CEO of AIT Technologies Pte Ltd •  Build Virtual Reality 3D Website using Web Development way - MetaRoom Markup - Jia Hen, CEO, VRcollab @wizztjh  Agenda 7.00 pm - Networking/ interesting VR video or link sharing/ Introduction 7.30 pm - Speaker's talk 9.00 pm - Networking
events.location: #03-04, IDA labs @ National Design Centre,  #03-04, 111 Middle Road, 188969, Singapore
events.group_name: SGVRAR - SG Virtual Reality/Augmented Reality meetup

events.name: Hackware v1.0
events.description:
Hackware reaches v1.0! 

Hackware is a monthly meetup for hardware developers and enthusiasts to share hacks and developments in the hardware scene, promote hardware development and to build a community of hardware developers. 

Agenda & Talks for this meetup:

1. ChorusText (http://www.chorustext.org/) - David Effendi 

2. Neobombe (http://lohjianhui.com/2015/07/19/the-making-of-the-neobombe-prototype/) - Mithru Vigneshwara

3. Developing IoT solutions with ESP8266: A Sharing from MakerAsia's experience" - William Hooi

4. Gimbal-arduino mounted LASER-pointer thingy - Martin Andrews (lightning) 

Announcements by anyone on:
1. Hiring positions
2. Available for hire
3. Other upcoming hardware-related events

Socialize and Network with other Hackware members.

Talks : ~20mins
Lightning Talks : ~5mins
Announcements: ~1min

events.name: Double Bill !! Dependency Injection + Streaming File Uploads with Spray.io
events.description: Yes it's that time again and we have 2 full talks of back to back Scala awesomeness crammed in... Talk 1: Overview of dependency injection methods in Scala.  I'll try to compare them and give brief intro. Currently I'm planning to cover:  • Cake Pattern • Reader Monad • MacWire  • Maybe some others + mention older Java ways.  Time is limited so I can't go into deep details on each one but I'll try to cover the most interesting parts. I'll drop a link to the code when ready. Speaker: Alexis  Talk A:  Handling large file uploads in Spray.io   When using Spray.io as the back-end for your service, special care must be taken in handling large file uploads such as mp3 and movie files. In this talk we are going to discuss the motivation, means as well as the current implementation shortcomings that the programmer must face. Speaker: Ganesh
events.location: ThoughtWorks office, 87B Amoy Street, Level 3, Singapore
